Job Title: Analyst, Financial

Location: Denver, CO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
2000 16th Street, Denver, Colorado, 80202, United States of America

DaVita is currently seeking a Financial Analyst to join our high performing corporate finance team. The ideal candidate will be a quick-learner with a strong sense of "team" and the ability to build relationships with cross-functional partners. The person in this position will be challenged to critically think through complex problems and help solve critical business issues that affect daily operations and overall financial performance. This position and team is based in Denver, Colorado.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

The following duties and responsibilities generally reflect the expectations of this position but are not intended to be all-inclusive.

Analytics

Strong foundation in quantitative concepts (e.g. financial, statistical, forecasting, etc.)Manage, develop and execute highly visible financial reports that allow C-level executives to identify opportunities and risk areas for future business performanceDevelop financial models and perform analyses that support strategic decision making for DaVita executive leadersSupport the annual enterprise-level budget and long-term strategic forecast processes as well as monthly and quarterly forecasts for developing Wall Street earnings guidanceContribute to presentations for senior executives as neededOther strategic, operational, financial or special projects as needed

Accountability

Deliver on-time and accurate recurring financial reporting that provide meaningful insights and drive strategic decision making by our senior executivesAbility to prioritize multiple tasks, identifying and acting on most important business problems to solveDrive actionable recommendations from synthesis of insights that push partners to differential results or new strategiesAppropriately manage potential roadblocks proactively identifying, communicating, and solving issues

Communication

Prioritize communications to focus on most critical information with a bias towards actionContribute to effective communication including insights and progress towards results

Team

Contribute to a team environment of trust and learning with multi-directional feedbackCollaborate with and participate in cross-functional teams across numerous finance lanes on special projects

Development

Aggressively pursue professional development opportunities available to DaVita TeammatesAbility to quickly take action on tactical feedback and develop over time

Desired Qualifications

BA or BS in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics or other quantitative field1+ years of experience in a financial analyst role, equivalent certification (e.g. CFA, CPA) or advanced degree (e.g., Masters in Finance) preferred but not requiredFamiliarity with financial statements, the relationships among them and the underlying business operations they representExperience with and understanding of financial analysis, financial modeling or profitability analysis techniques preferred but not requiredExperience with analytical methods and software, financial planning, accounting or other database systems such as Anaplan, Hyperion Essbase, VBA, Python or SQL a plusIntellectually curious, eager to learn and comfortable with ambiguitySolid work ethic, including ability to follow-up, focus on details and take initiativeStrong verbal and written communication skills: able to communicate effectively with teammates both internal and external to finance and at senior levels of the organizationAdvanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPointEffective time management and organization skillsTeam player with a great attitude who lives our Core Value of Fun

At DaVita, we strive to be a community first and a company second. We want all teammates to experience DaVita as "a place where I belong." Our goal is to embed Diversity & Belonging into everything we do in our Village, so that it becomes part of who we are. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. As such, individuals are recruited, hired, assigned and promoted without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

Applications are accepted on an ongoing basis.

Salary/ Wage Range

$51,400.00 - $75,500.00 / year

Compensation for the role will depend on a number of factors, including a candidateâ€™s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience and may fall outside of the range shown. DaVita offers a competitive total rewards package, which includes a 401k match, healthcare coverage and a broad range of other benefits. Learn more at https://careers.davita.com/benefits

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
